cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.product

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.product.Device

  • public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
    Devices represent unique mobile phones, tablets, etc. that can be used with the Mobile Application Store. Content items may be used with particular Devices. Note that the IProductAPI will only contain one instance of each unique Device to conserve resources (following the Flyweight pattern).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Killeffer <rayden7@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    ProductAPI, Content

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object compare)
      Since Device objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all device items be unique, this method provides a way to determine if another Device item is the same as the current one.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object compare)
        Since Device objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all device items be unique, this method provides a way to determine if another Device item is the same as the current one. Uses the Apache Commons EqualsBuilder to determine if the two objects are indeed equal to each other.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        compare - the Device item to compare to the current object to test for equality
        Returns:
        true if the objects are the same, false otherwise
        See Also:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27581/overriding-equals-and-hashcode-in-java, http://www.java-tutorial.ch/core-java-tutorial/equalsbuilder, http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-2.6/org/apache/commons/lang/builder/EqualsBuilder.html

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Since Device objects may be added to collections, and also since the IProductAPI enforces that all Device items be unique, this method provides a way to get the unique hash code for the current device. Uses the Apache Commons HashCodeBuilder to generate a unique hash code for the current item based on two randomly chosen unique prime numbers and all the object properties.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a unique integer hash code for this particular object
        See Also:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27581/overriding-equals-and-hashcode-in-java, http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-2.6/org/apache/commons/lang/builder/HashCodeBuilder.html, http://primes.utm.edu/lists/small/1000.txt
